definition[0]: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
example[0]: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
example[1]: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
definition[1]: a feeling of fear or worry because something bad or dangerous might happen
example[3]: Scientists have said there is no cause for alarm.
example[4]: There is growing alarm at the increase in crime.
example[6]: I’ve set the alarm for 7 o'clock.
example[7]: I was still asleep when the alarm went off.
example[8]: Neighbours heard the burglar alarm and called the police.
example[9]: The house has a system of security alarms.
example[10]: A fire alarm went off and the building had to be evacuated.
example[11]: I was woken by a car alarm in the middle of the night.
example[12]: Is the baby alarm switched on?
example[13]: If you are nervous, invest in a personal alarm.
example[14]: He hit the alarm button under the desk.
example[16]: A window blew open, setting off the alarm.
example[17]: Did you set the burglar alarm?
example[18]: The thieves fled when an alarm went off.
example[19]: I entered the shop and switched off the alarm.
definition[3]: to make someone feel worried or frightened
example[20]: I don’t want to alarm you, but I can’t find the key.
